name: Marriott Hotel

reviews.text: We arrived in Poland in February to snow and Warsaw looked just like a postcard!
reviews.title: Winter Postcard

reviews.text: We had a terrific view from our room on the 24th floor overlooking the Science and Culture museum. We stayed at the Marriott for five days with our two children in a family room. The hotel was what you would expect from a 5* hotel - beautiful hotel, very clean and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Great Location and service
Great place to visit
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location for exploring the city and for those of you who love shopping, and more importantly those of you who love designer wear, this is the city for you!!

reviews.title: Fantastic Place
reviews.text: The bars in the hotel are expensive - before going to the Panoramic Bar first check that you don't already have the same view from your bedroom window as the bar prices here are not cheap! The Lobby Bar is also expensive so we would suggest drinking outside of the hotel.

reviews.title: Very good location
reviews.text: The Champions Sports Bar, which is owned by the hotel, is far less expensive and serves good food. The staff were very friendly with the majority speaking very good English. "Happy hour" is from 5-7 pm weekdays and from Friday night to Sunday closing. Beer prices approx 7.5 szl at happy hour rate and 12 szl at other times.

I`ve visited most of the hotels in central Warsaw over the years, but never the Marriott. The Champions bar downstairs is great to watch the live sports ( they show most of the Champions League, Premiership and La liga games) and I`m afraid that`s about it.
reviews.title: Dissapointing

likes.liked: — The location - right in the centre of town
likes.disliked: — Over-priced, small rooms and breakfast was just crazy!

reviews.text: Breakfast is what can only be described as a free-for-all - that`s if you can get a seat. The breakfast is passable and if you have 20 mins to wait on coffee ..
reviews.title: Highly recommended...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms ( I booked an executive room ) are very small with large enough bed, tv, steam-iron and ironing board. They could do with a lick of paint too..
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom was very small, with a shower over the bath, but it was clean.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.text: Overall, dissapointing, Wished I paid the extra £20 and went back to the Westin
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Beautiful Hotel, excellent location and extremely helpful staff
reviews.title: Above Average

reviews.text: My mother and I were there for a week, for the European Ice Skating Championships.
reviews.title: Was not impressed!

reviews.text: There were several problems with this hotel:
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: 1. The staff was not friendly at all...for example we asked for bath robes (there weren't any in our room) and the lady at the reception told us that only executive rooms get bath robes! She seemed to have forgotten that she works in a 5 star hotel. Finally they provided us with some, but they acted like they were doing us a huge favour.
reviews.title: Great hotel, no so great city!

reviews.text: 2. The room was tiny, there were two double beds which took up the whole room. On every bed there were 6(!) pillows. Every night we had to put aside 10 out of the 12 pillows and every day the cleaning lady would put them back.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — The Rooms, The Beds, Free Internet, Breakfast, Health Club

reviews.text: I stayed two weeks in this hotel twice for business. My experience was great. The hotel staff is very efficient. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. The view from the room is very nice also.
reviews.title: Excellent business trip

reviews.text: The hotel breakfast is delicious. There is also a good Italian restaurant and some bars, besides the casino. The gym is very good, swimming pool and saunas also.
reviews.title: Escellent hotel in Warsaw

reviews.text: The hotel location is very good, next to the Palace of Culture.
reviews.title: Comfort in Warsaw
Warsaw - Stag w/end
reviews.text: I recommend this hotel not only for business but also for pleasure.

I stayed at the Marriott 3 days in early June. The hotel deserves its 5 stars rating with quiet and comfortable rooms, friendly staff and very good breakfast buffet. They also have their own taxi drivers with brand new Mercedes. The hotel is quite central (in front of the train station) but about a 15 minute walk to the old town. On the ground floor there is a lot of services such as cafe, restaurant, ATM, Budget rent a car and Avis.
reviews.title: The place to stay in Warsaw

description: Located in the heart of Poland’s capital city, Warsaw Marriott Hotel offers not only easy access to all major sightseeing attractions and financial district but mostly elegant and comfortable interiors.The hotel offers 518 beautifully appointed guest rooms, including 95 suites, 3 Concierge levels; on-site parking and shopping area. In each room guest will find new bed from Marriott, with down comforters, designer duvets and fluffier pillows and amenities like tea and coffee maker, spacious work area and Wi-Fi in rooms.The hotel is also a home to chic shopping gallery and tempting dining options, including the enchanting Parmizzano's Restaurant, famous for its fine Italian cuisine and 40th floor Panorama Bar & Lounge with magnificent views over Warsaw.The World Class Health Academy provides state of the art equipment for a thorough workout, swimming pool, sauna, steam bath and newly opened Euphoria Spa.For business and social events, the Warsaw Marriott Hotel offers over 2,600 sq m of flexible meeting and exhibition venue including 19 meeting rooms.
